title: Prime Minister of Saudi Arabia - Wikipedia
snippet: The prime minister is always either the king of Saudi Arabia or crown prince of Saudi Arabia. Prince Mohammed bin Salman has been the prime minister since 27 September 2022. The office was created along with the Council of Ministers on 9 October 1953, by decree of King Saud.

title: Saudi Arabia - Heads of Government Listing - HOG
snippet: The Heads of Government listing is a database that contains information on the names and titles of heads of state, heads of government, foreign ministers and in some cases, ministers responsible for development assistance.

title: Mohammed bin Salman | Biography, Saudi Arabia, Father, & Mother | Britannica
snippet: Mohammed bin Salman (born August 31, 1985) is the de facto ruler of Saudi Arabia, known for his aggressive foreign policy, ambitious economic vision, and controversial social reforms.

title: Mohammed bin Salman - Wikipedia
snippet: In October 2017, Mohammed said that the ultra-conservative Saudi state had not been "normal" for the past 30 years, blaming rigid doctrines that had governed society in a reaction to the Iranian Revolution, which successive leaders "didn't know how to deal with". He stated that he aimed to have Saudi Arabia start "returning to what we were before—a country of moderate Islam that is open to all religions and to the world". This amounted to telling the country's clerics that the deal the royal family struck with them after the Grand Mosque seizure was to be renegotiated.
